_header: Jesu Thy name honored might be
Subjects: Christ, prayers to; prayers, to Christ
_description: A prayer to Jesus — five 8-line stanzas (abababab)

CamTCC223.First Lines:
Ihesu þi name honourde myȝt bewith al þat any lyfe
                    is in…
CamTCC223.Last Lines:
…Þu wesche a way al my mysdede& graunt me blyse
                    withouten ende Amen
CamTCC223.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 139-40.
Patterson,  Frank A. 
             The Middle English Penitential Lyric.
Columbia University Studies in English.
         New York: Columbia Press, 1911: 134-5.

Chetham6691.First Lines:
Ihesu þi name honoured beWiþ alle þat ony lyf is
                    Inne…
Chetham6691.Last Lines:
…Wasche awey al my mysdedeAnd graunte me blysse withouten ende
                    Amen

Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
